reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from our 2nd stay at the Bali Hyatt and it was as pleasurable as the first and the gardens were as lovely as ever.
reviews.title: Transport, Glass bottom boat, massssaaggggggggggeeee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed for 10 nights with my wife and 3 young children of 10, 3 and 1. The kids really enjoyed the pools and the 10 year old particularly liked the table tennis and pool table available( Table tennis is free and the pool is $1US a game). On the downside the hotel pools didn't seem to be cleaned of debris often enough and the sight of a floating brown lump one day was very disturbing.
reviews.title: Clean & full of smiley staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff are very friendly at all times and very helpful. If you have young children I can fully recommend the baby sitting services at the hotel. We went out on our own for our wedding anniversary and a fantastic lady looked after the kids for a very inexpensive amount approx £2 an hour per child.
reviews.title: Good and Reliable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of the rooms they are in a desperate need of an upgrade. We were put in the nearest block to the swimming pool and the room was as it was two years ago. The bathroom plug was disgustingly grubby and cigarette smoke came through the air conditioning on a regular basis which was disgusting, however it didn't ruin our stay.
reviews.title: Our stay at the Bali Hyatt was exceptional.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: In terms of the surrounding area transport is on tap with many drivers wanting to take you anywhere you want to go and constant offers of a massage and glass boat. We had a few trips out and I can fully recommend playing one off against the other to get the price down. We went to a wedding in Kuta and the driver waited 8 hours for us and charged £7 amazing. You can generally get a driver for the whole day to go wherever you want for around £25 be careful to check the vehicle as some are very old and unsafe.
reviews.title: Mixed Emotions - Hotel vs Bali/Sanur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a brill holiday at Bali Hyatt this July. Staff 100 % . Management should be very proud of all their workers. Great Location on the beach front and being able to walk into Sanur a real treat. Great Bars and Resturants in the area. Very reasonable and yummy food.
reviews.title: Well Worth the Long Haul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Didnt feel hassled by any of the vendors on beach at all.
reviews.title: The perfect honeymoon resort in Bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel excellent for all facilities. Nothing too much trouble.
reviews.title: Ok place, but not what I expected from a Hyatt property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: All in all a fab time had by all and hoefully will return next year.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in beautiful garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 8 magic days at the wonderful resort of the Bali Hyatt. A more relaxing destination you will never find - paradise on earth!. Welcomed with fanfare and garlands - we knew we had arrived in Bali! There are numerous restaurants in the resort to choose from offering various cuisines, from Italian, Indonesian to Chinese! All were fabulous and excellent value. The staff were amazingly friendly and courteous. The hotel is modern but dated, renovations are being undertaken currently. The room was wonderful, overlooking the ocean, the bathroom however is more like a 3 star hotel standard. Rooms are cleaned daily, our beds were turned down nightly and fruit/water changed too. As we were Regency guests, there were drinks and canapes each evening from 5pm to 7pm with local music provided. You can choose to stay in touch with the outside world or not as daily newspapers are provided. On the lower ground floor there are a number of shops, customer service, money changing service, doctor, internet, gym and of course spa. Bring a few books as lounging by the pools/sea is the predominant pastime - very relaxing with pool service as required. Do spoil yourself at least once by receiving a full Aromatherapy massage! We went to Kuta on one night which was an experience - a bit more night life! We had drinks in the entertainment bar nightly where a band also played. Go whitewater rafting in Sobek - it is excellent value and fun. Should you choose, there is no need to leave the resort for your entire sejour. It is definetly the closest to heaven we have ever been - the perfect honeymoon destination. Have your transfers arranged - it saves lots of hassle upon arrival (especially late at night). Overall, the perfect honeymoon resort and destination.
reviews.title: Hyatt Days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can I say...pure paradise with Balinese charm!! We absolutly love Bali and we would definitly return to The Bali Hyatt. The grounds are just magical and there is a serene atmosphere throughout the hotel. We stayed in a Regency Club room and it was worth that little bit extra. Regency Club opened from 5 till 7 in the evenings where you can enjoy complimetary food and drinks in a wonderful setting. Our room was nice and as said in other reviews the bathroom could do with refurbishment. The pools are fabulous and beach is spotless. We walked the lenght of the beach of Sanur and the hyatt had in our opinion the best grounds, beach and pools of all the hotels.
reviews.title: Memorable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're thinking of going to Bali then consider the hyatt.
reviews.title: Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, if you're looking for a driver I can highly recommend Dean, you can get his details in the forums.
reviews.title: great holiday

likes.liked: — nice size room ,pleasant decor good sea view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: We enjoyed 9 nights of pure relaxation at the Hyatt following on from a hectic 4 nights in Singapore. The hotel is quite simply paradise! We stayed in a garden view room in the Hibiscus block - an ideal location as close to all of the amenities but still quiet at night. The hotel grounds are absolutely beautiful with two swimming pools that are fantastic for a dip to cool down. We spent much of our time relaxing on the beach as we found that there was a lovely breeze that helped with the heat!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel, Couldn't Fault It!
Great hotel in Bali!
reviews.text: The staff can not do enough for you - I have stayed in many hotels around the world with work and can honestly say that I have never experienced service as good in any other hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bali Hyatt in Sanur was a beautiful hotel with friendly helpful staff and picturesque gardens and pools. I would not hesitate to recommend it to others if they wanted a relaxing enjoyable week by the sea. You can't swim in the sea due to the tide and the seaweed but you can swim in the pools and still walk along the beach. The piano bar was lovely in the evenings and there weren't many kids disturbing the peace and quiet - it was bliss.
reviews.title: Beautiful Bali Hyatt

likes.liked: — The beautiful reception areas, gardens and friendly staff
likes.disliked: — The rooms could have had a bigger wow factor and couldn't swim in sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Grand Bali Hyatt for our second week in Nusa Dua and this was also fabulous - the accomodation was definitely a step up and the hotel a lot bigger with more pools and better beach where you could swim in the sea but more touristy, more expensive and with more kids. Each to their own - we had a great honeymoon staying at both!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned from 9 nights at the Hyatt and wish I was still there!
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in, in terms of how much I enjoyed my stay - I travel regularly for work and often stay in well-rated and expensive hotels, albeit usually in cities rather than resorts.
reviews.title: go for it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It would be impossible to run an operation like this in the West. The time and care thast goes into everything is incredible - people are continually clearing up, sweeping sand off the path, clearing up leaves from the gardens, etc. Take a wander up the beach beyond the hotel and it will dawn on you that the beach isn't like that the whole way up; rather, it is immaculately maintained by the hotel staff. Hence, if you stay elsewhere in Sanur you will probably have a much less nice bit of beach in front of your hotel or villa.
reviews.title: Hyatt Family Delight

likes.disliked: — Bathrooms were fine but out dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 7 day stay at the hotel. It is pure paradise.
reviews.title: Unbelievable!! Paradise - What else do you need.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes the hotel may not be up to date compared to say the Grand Hyatt which we visited, but, it has a very special feeling about it.
reviews.title: Best hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a "Regency Club" room which was great and a little more upto date than a standard room.
reviews.title: Not the real Bali

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was immaculately clean and room service attended twice a day to change towels and turn down the bed.
reviews.title: Not one more time

likes.disliked: — it is not a place to be for business, or if you need service on time

reviews.title: Loved it!
reviews.text: All the staff were very pleasant and helped with any problems.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bali Hyatt for 12 nights in April. The hotel itself was great, the staff were lovely, and the gardens were amazing. The two pools were nice although the sun beds around the pools were taken quite early, however there were enough beds to sit in the gardens or on the beach which was a lot quieter. The breakfast was lovely, filtered coffee and lots of choice. We used room service a few times which was good and the prices were not too expensive although it is a lot cheaper to eat outside the hotel.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Sanur

likes.disliked: — The Beaches to the left and right of the Hotel grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were lovely although we had read the rooms were tired (not the case with ours at all). We had an ocean view room and our room was lovely. The pillows and king size bed were so comfortable and the towels were big and thick. The sink plug hole did occasionally smell but that wasn’t really a problem. The room was not humid as you have a machine in the room to control this.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa is nice but very expensive compared to outside the hotel. If you like a nice hotel and you do want to visit Bali and Sanur then this hotel is really traditional and pretty.
reviews.title: Lovely time at the Bali Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate out at a place called 'The Village' a few times and this cost about £20 for two people in total (more expensive than the other restaurants we went to) but is the nicest looking restaurant in Sanur just past Hardy's supermarket. We expected Sanur to be quiet, but not as quiet as it was. We were going in about 10pm most nights after our meal as there aren't many bars at all. Sometimes it felt like we were the only tourists walking back to our hotel. The people are friendly and not once did we feel unsafe even when we went to Kuta for a few hours.
reviews.title: lovely peaceful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was fantastic; I think we only had 10 mins of rain in 12 days. This was our first trip to Bali and even though we loved this hotel if you go beyond the beach outside the Bali Hyatt it isn’t very nice, it was quite disappointing. The beach at the hotel is lovely but the sea is full of seaweed and not very inviting considering you are in the Indian Ocean. The beach to the left and right of the hotel isn’t very nice. There are stalls/shops either side of the hotel and you do get asked a number of times if you want transport or a massage and the rubbish on the beaches outside these stalls is not very nice. If you are expecting paradise when you go to Bali I think you maybe a bit disappointed. We thought the country itself was pretty and green when we travelled outside the hotel to see the Rice Fields and moutains etc but they should really keep the beaches tidy as that was a total put off, you do not see or hear about this so just be aware.
reviews.title: Nice Play To Stay

likes.disliked: — Sort of dated rooms, smallish size, not the best beach to swim in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: If you see the building from outside it is ugly that I admit, but
reviews.title: Good old time in big hotel chain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: they have big beautiful garden, old type of furniture (which I like) and well trained staff.
reviews.title: Just Above Terrible

likes.liked: — Good location with local arts and crafts and food nearby.
likes.disliked: — It felt more like Hyatt's version of Bali then Bali.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007
reviews.text: One of the best parts of Bali Hyatt is the' thickness of towel'.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Not many hotels offer such one. And also the 'croissant' at the breakfast that was just like European made. I hope they keep the recipe.
reviews.title: Terrible hotel - concrete and waste of time

likes.liked: — Maybe Sanur, the sity close to it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Their SPA’s treatment was not so good (maybe only that girl?), however, you pay 10 times more than the local price. Well, you are treated in a separate 'house' only for 1 person, it could be kind of luxury.
reviews.title: Totally COOL!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 12 nights starting on 22nd June 09.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the hotel is old and the three accommodation blocks are not very pretty, as they are constructed of concrete. However, they are making the effort to grow greenery over some of the concrete, which does help.
reviews.title: Relaxation in style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The communal buildings - reception, restaurants etc are beautiful. The staff are wonderful and can't do enough to help guests. The extensive gardens are magnificent. There are 2 pools and you can find a sunbed any time. There are also sunbeds on the beach, which is kept immaculately clean. Towels are provided free and you can change them as often as you need.
reviews.title: Amazing gardens and setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were fortunate in booking a Regency Club Room which, if you can afford the upgrade, is well worth it. "Continental" breakfast is included in the rate as are evening cocktails and snacks from 5pm to 7pm. Although breakfast is described as "Continental" the only thing which wasn't available seemed to be bacon which isn't a problem! You can also have coffee and soft drinks all day. The rooms are lovely with bath and shower and all amenities you could wish for. Towels were changed twice a day and our bottled water topped up twice a day as well.
reviews.title: A marriage of Bali style, a corporate hotel, but missing the personal touch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From day 1, they greeted guests by name, something I have never experienced before.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel - beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the Bali Hyatt over Chinese New Year in February and loved it. The gardens are beautiful and resplendent with wonderful birds, squirrels, fish and lizards. It really seems to be a peaceful and natural spot.
reviews.title: Tranquil and Beautiful sums up the Bali Hyatt
Harsh beginning
reviews.text: The rooms were up to standard in a 5* hotel, we had a big balcony and views over the gardens. The fruit bowl was replenished daily with lovely tropical friuts and complimentary water. The rooms were cleaned twice a day and towels replaced reguarly. Yes, the bathrooms are a little old and the toilet position a bit strange but clean and useable. The air-con was a little hot for us even on the lowest setting. We had a top floor room and never heard any noise from other rooms or guests. Everything we asked for in our booking was provided - connecting and non smoking rooms. We greatly enjoyed the Recency Club, with free daily tea and coffee and nibbles and cocktails from 5-7pm. The service in the club was wonderful and the ambience relaxing. Our boys enjoyed the food there and the drinks.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other restaurants in the hotel were good, we enjoyed the spectacular breakfasat buffet at the Wantilan Cafe, the Italian resturant and the Wednesday buffet evening meal with a traditional Balinese dance performance. The dance was very impressive! The restaurants outside are of course cheaper but beware the ones that use MSG in quantity in their cooking! The exception was the excellent Italian Restaurant 5 mins walk left as you turn out of the hotel. This served great food, at a good cost with no MSG - watch out for the impressive range of ice creams at the stand at the entrance. Our only slight gripe about the restaurants in the hotel (and the Italian up the road) were the small non-smoking areas. Being non-smokers we found the hotel and Bali in general had very few areas for non-smokers to enjoy fresh air. The Wantilan Cafe smoking tables were far better situated than the non-smoking tables and the hotel seemed to have loads of smoking guests when we were there.
reviews.title: Really relaxing place, great facilities, perfect for families

likes.liked: — The pool and its seaside setting was just stunning
likes.disliked: — The room, but really - how much time do you spend in it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel had good facilities, including the fabulous swimming pool areas and beach. We also enjoyed the badminton court and the bikes - cycling along the beach path was enjoyable and easy. Its a shame that the hotel imposes small charges on facilities, many other 5* hotels provide these for free.
reviews.title: Fit like an old shoe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Try to get to the Waterbom park at Kuta (go by taxi) if you have children, they will love the water slides and book yourself a pagoda for the day to relax in with shade. We also enjoyed a tour to Lembongan island with Bali Hai tours and a look at the area around Ubud. We will certainly reurn to Bali, there is so much to do, but next time we will be sure to bring US DOLLARS as well as Rupiah as so much is charged in US $ and the exchange rate is much better at home than in Bali.
reviews.title: Love the Bali Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I returned from a week stay yesterday and we both thought the hotel was wonderful! I am in a wheelchair and did not leave the hotel during that week and I was not bored or in anyway tired of the surroundings.
reviews.title: Fabulous hotel with a remarable garden!

likes.liked: — The quality of the restaurants and the magnificent gardens.
likes.disliked: — The bathroom in the handicapped room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several years ago we stayed at the Grand Hyatt in Nusa Dua and we feel that this Sanur hotel is superior even though the Grand is supposed to be better. Although much smaller, the Bali Hyatt has the most remarkable gardens and to be able to have breakfast or dinner sitting at the edge of a lush, tropical garden with giant Koi quietly swimming under water lillies was a wonderfully magical moment.
reviews.title: Healt Hazard
Absolutely Fantastic
reviews.text: There was nothing negative about my handicapped room; it had none of the musty problems mentioned by other commentators even though the Bali weather seemed particularly humid. The Balinese staff were brilliantly understated and attentive and Diane and I anticipate a return visit annually. I recommend the hotel in the highest manner to any potential guests.

reviews.title: Magnificent hotel
reviews.text: This Hyatt is way outdated. We were offered 6(!) different Deluxe and Regency Club rooms, but they all had the same damp problem and were therefor equipped with dehumidifiers(!) The rooms smell musty, de sheets are moist. We had booked in advance for 3 nights but because this health hazard we checked out the next morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bali Hyatt end of September and it was absolutely magical!
reviews.title: Rooms let it down, but lovely overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Have just come come from 2 weeks holiday at the Bali Hyatt and cannot reccommend this hotel highly enough. The surroundings and gardens are just beautiful, staff so friendly and helpful. Some of the decor might be a little tired but they are contstantly working on this. Our room was serviced twice a day, not had that with a hotel before. Again a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: Fantaxtic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bali Hyatt for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon in Asia and we had a fantastic time. I was a little concerned after reading negetive reviews about the hotel but after staying there I realy cannot understand why people can write anything negetive about this wonderful hotel!
reviews.title: heaven at the Bali Hyatt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived after a short flight from Singapore and the welcome we received was unlike any welcome I have ever received at any hotel before. the staff sat us down and made us feel at home with a lovely cocktail and a flower garland. We arrived quite early and our room was not ready as we had booked a sea view but we were happy to sit by the pool until our room was ready which was 4pm. The room itself was a good size with a lovely view of the gardens and sea and although a little musty this was understandable because of the humidity.
reviews.title: The Best Spa Ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The pool area at the hotel was beautiful and the staff were fantastic. I can't understand why people complain about the pices at the hotel. we ate luch 4 times, dinner twice and had drinks by the pool every day (happy hour at the pool bar!) and our bill was only £120 for the two of us at the end of the holiday which we thought was fantastic in comparison to European prices. Fair enough it was more expensive that the resort restaurants but was worth it for the convenience.
reviews.title: Older, but comfortable.

likes.disliked: — The exterior of the hotel rooms

reviews.title: A big hotel that still feels personal.
reviews.text: Restaurants in resort were fantastic and so cheap! We booked a driver for 2 days (Dean) who was fabulous and we got the chance to see the 'Real' Bali by doing this which was worth every penny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at the Griya Santrian last year we decided this year to book the Bali Hyatt and we didn't regret for one moment. We stayed at the regency club room and everything said about the room is true. It's not the biggest room (to be honest it was the smallest room from the 5 accommodations we stayed in this year) but everything you need was in it like a big safe, minibar, coffee and tea facilities, a seperate shower, bathtub and 4 big and fluffy bathtowels (2 smaller ones as well) which were replaced every night if used.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, we enjoyed the regency club

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the regency club lounge very much. We had breakfast there 4 times, once we tried the Wantilan Cafe but we prefered the Club. It's situated in the middle of the huge and beautiful garden (38 acres!) and between 5 and 7 pm you can enjoy included drinks and great nibbles (3 cold appetizers, 2 warm, 3 cheeses etc). The swimming pools were great, always enough sunbeds in the garden, around the swimmingpools and on the beach. You can change your pooltowel (2x1meter!) as much as you like. Don't miss the great sunrise on the beach! It's worth an early wake-up. When you arrive there is a fragipani garland, a cool drink and a check-in on a couch. You won't regret a stay in this hotel, compared to Griya Santrian this is 5 stars and Griya is 3 stars.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in the Hyatt in July and we loved it! It's a big hotel, but we didn't have that feeling at all. It's very cosy, very relaxing, with 2 wonderful pools in a beautiful garden and very friendly staff. There was nothing we can complain about!
reviews.title: beautiful gardens and a really nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to Sanur. On the first visit we stayed at another hotel, which was OK but the Hyatt looked nicer - and it definitely was. The gardens are spectacular, the pools are nice, staff are fantastic. We didn't think the food was particularly good (though not bad either), and in general in Sanur we found that the food wasn't as good as in Seminyak where there are many first-class restaurants. Our favourite restaurant in Sanur was The Village, a modern Italian place which is a short taxi ride or longish walk from the Hyatt, on the same road (turn right from the Hyatt); gorgeous food.
reviews.title: Absolutely fablous hotel in great location , *****Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Curiously, The Village's sister restaurant, Mezzanine, was really dreadful; supposedly fusion Pacific Rim food but just horrible.
reviews.title: Large but still peaceful and a lovely hotel
